zoBuffer.h : Byte ring buffers.
[Software utilities]

Data Structures

struct  ZO_BUFFER
 Buffer type. More...

Defines

#define ZO_BUFFER_DEFAULTS   {0,0,0,0,0}
 Default ZO_BUFFER variable initializer.

Functions

bool zoBufferInit (ZO_BUFFER *p, u08 size)
 Initializes a ZO_BUFFER variable. Always initialize a buffer variable with this function before calling any other function.
void zoBufferPut (ZO_BUFFER *p, const u08 data)
 Stores a byte in the buffer. Check for a space in the buffer with zoBufferIsFull() function.
u08 zoBufferGet (ZO_BUFFER *p)
 Gets a byte from the buffer. Check if there are any data in the buffer with the zoBufferIsEmpty() function.
u08 zoBufferRead (ZO_BUFFER *p, u08 index)
 Reads a byte in the buffer at specific index. The zoBufferRead() function does not take the byte out of he buffer like the zoBufferGet() function does.
bool zoBufferIsEmpty (ZO_BUFFER *p)
 Checks if the buffer is empty.
bool zoBufferIsFull (ZO_BUFFER *p)
 Checks if the buffer is full.
void zoBufferFlush (ZO_BUFFER *p)
 Flushes the buffer. All data in the buffer are discarded.
void zoBufferPutIsr (ZO_BUFFER *p, const u08 data)
 Inline unprotected version of zoBufferPut() for use in ISRs.
u08 zoBufferGetIsr (ZO_BUFFER *p)
 Inline unprotected version of zoBufferGet() for use in ISRs.
u08 zoBufferReadIsr (ZO_BUFFER *p, u08 index)
 Inline unprotected version of zoBufferRead() for use in ISRs.

Detailed Description

Overview
This library provides byte buffering functionality. The buffer is protected from data corruption that may occur by the interference of ISR code, thus it can be declared at local or global scope with no worries.
Usage example 
 #include "zoTypes.h"
 #include "zoBuffer.h"

 ZO_BUFFER MyBuffer = ZO_BUFFER_DEFAULTS;    //declare a global buffer

 int main(void)
 {
     u08 c;
       
     zoBufferInit(&MyBuffer,10);        //initialize the buffer to a size of ten bytes
        
     zoBufferPut(&MyBuffer,'i');        //put the char i into the buffer
 
     if(!zoBufferIsFull())              //check if the buffer is full; if not:
         zoBufferPut(&MyBuffer,23);     //put the number 23 into the buffer

     if(!zoBufferIsEmpty())             //check if the buffer is empty; if not:
         c = zoBufferGet(&MyBuffer);    //get the 'oldest' byte stored in the buffer
                                        //thus 'i' is assigned to c.
 }

Function Documentation

bool zoBufferInit ( ZO_BUFFER *  p,
u08  size 
)

Initializes a ZO_BUFFER variable. Always initialize a buffer variable with this function before calling any other function.

Parameters:
*p A pointer to the buffer variable.
size The maximum number of bytes the buffer can store.
Returns:
success of memory allocation for the buffer
void zoBufferPut ( ZO_BUFFER *  p,
const u08  data 
)

Stores a byte in the buffer. Check for a space in the buffer with zoBufferIsFull() function.

Parameters:
*p Pointer to the buffer variable.
data The byte to store.
u08 zoBufferGet ( ZO_BUFFER *  p  ) 

Gets a byte from the buffer. Check if there are any data in the buffer with the zoBufferIsEmpty() function.

Parameters:
*p Pointer to the buffer variable.
Returns:
the 'oldest' byte stored last in the buffer. If the buffer is empty the byte returned is garbage.
u08 zoBufferRead ( ZO_BUFFER *  p,
u08  index 
)

Reads a byte in the buffer at specific index. The zoBufferRead() function does not take the byte out of he buffer like the zoBufferGet() function does.

Parameters:
*p Pointer to the buffer variable.
index Where to read the byte in the buffer.Index is relative to the 'oldest' byte stored in the buffer. Thus index=0 means the 'oldest' byte in the buffer, index=1 the next and so on. If index is greater than the buffer size the return byte is garbage.
Returns:
the byte read.
bool zoBufferIsEmpty ( ZO_BUFFER *  p  )  [inline]

Checks if the buffer is empty.

Parameters:
*p Pointer to the buffer variable.
Returns:
true if the buffer is empty, false if it isn't.
bool zoBufferIsFull ( ZO_BUFFER *  p  )  [inline]

Checks if the buffer is full.

Parameters:
*p Pointer to the buffer variable.
Returns:
true if the buffer is full, false if it isn't
void zoBufferFlush ( ZO_BUFFER *  p  ) 

Flushes the buffer. All data in the buffer are discarded.

Parameters:
*p Pointer to the buffer variable.
